classes.name: Client
classes.description: The YAMDBF Client through which you can access [storage]{@link Client#storage} and any of the properties available on a typical Discord.js Client instance

properties.name: owner
properties.description: The owner/owners of the bot, represented as an array of IDs. These IDs determine who is allowed to use commands flagged as ownerOnly

properties.name: commandsDir
properties.description:
Directory to find command class files. Optional if client is passive.
See: {@link Client#passive}

properties.name: readyText
properties.description: Text to output when the client is ready. If not provided nothing will be logged, giving the opportunity to log something more dynamic on clientReady

properties.name: unknownCommandError
properties.description: Whether or not a generic 'command not found' message should be given in DMs to instruct the user to use the help command. true by default

properties.name: selfbot
properties.description: Whether or not the client is a selfbot

properties.name: passive
properties.description: Whether or not this client is passive. Passive clients will not register a command dispatcher or a message listener. This allows passive clients to be created that do not respond to any commands but are able to perform actions based on whatever the framework user wants

properties.name: pause
properties.description:
Whether or not the client will pause after loading Client Storage, giving the opportunity to add/change default settings before guild settings are created for the first time. If this is used, you must create a listener for 'pause', and emit 'continue' when you have finished doing what you need to do.

If adding new default settings is desired after guild settings have already been generated for the first time, they should be added after 'clientReady' so they can be properly pushed to the settings for all guilds

properties.name: disableBase
properties.description: Array of base command names to skip when loading commands. Base commands may only be disabled by name, not by alias

properties.name: plugins
properties.description: Loads plugins and contains loaded plugins in case accessing a loaded plugin at runtime is desired

properties.name: provider
properties.description: The chosen storage provider to use for the Client. Defaults to {@link JSONProvider}

properties.name: storage
properties.description: Client-specific storage. Also contains a guilds Collection property containing all GuildStorage instances

functions.name: start
functions.description: Starts the login process, culminating in the clientReady event

functions.name: continue
functions.description: Shortcut method for <Client>.emit('continue')

functions.name: loadCommand
functions.description: Loads/reloads all/specific commands

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: The name of a command to reload, or 'all' to load all commands

functions.name: isOwner
functions.description: Returns whether or not the given user is an owner of the client/bot

functions.name: setDefaultSetting
functions.description: Set the value of a default setting key and push it to all guild setting storages. Will not overwrite a setting in guild settings storage if there is already an existing key with the given value

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key to use in settings storage

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to use in settings storage

functions.name: removeDefaultSetting
functions.description: Remove a defaultGuildSettings item. Will not remove from any current guild settings, but will remove the item from the defaults added to new guild settings storages upon creation

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key to use in settings storage

functions.name: defaultSettingExists
functions.description: Check if a default guild setting exists

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The default settings key to check for

functions.name: getPrefix
functions.description: Shortcut to return the command prefix for the provided guild

parameters.name: guild
parameters.description: The Guild to get the prefix of

functions.name: sweepStorages
functions.description: Clean out any guild storage/settings that no longer have an associated guild

functions.name: use
functions.description:
Adds a middleware function to be used when any command is called to make modifications to args, determine if the command can be run, or anything else you want to do every time any command is called.

See {@link MiddlewareFunction} for information on how a middleware function should be represented

Usage example:

<Client>.use((message, args) => [message, args.map(a => a.toUpperCase())]);

This will add a middleware function to all commands that will attempt to transform all args to uppercase. This will of course fail if any of the args are not a string.

Note: Middleware functions should only be added to the client one time each and thus should not be added within any sort of event or loop. Multiple separate middleware functions can be added to the via multiple separate calls to this method

events.name: event:clientReady
events.description: Emitted when the client is ready. Should be used instead of Discord.js' ready event, as this is the point that everything is set up within the YAMDBF Client and it's all ready to go

events.name: event:command
events.description: Emitted whenever a command is successfully called

events.name: event:blacklistRemove
events.description: Emitted whenever a user is removed from the blacklist

events.name: event:pause
events.description: Emitted when the client is waiting for you to send a continue event, after which clientReady will be emitted

events.name: event:continue
events.description: To be emitted after the pause event when you have finished setting things up that should be set up before the client is ready for use

classes.name: Plugin
classes.description:
Abstract class for Client plugins to extend. Provides runtime errors for missing method implementations, and is necessary at compile-time when using TypeScript for the compiler to recognize a Plugin as valid.

Plugins will always be passed the YAMDBF Client instance when loaded. If you intend to do anything with it you must receive it in your plugin constructor which means you will need a super() call since you will be overriding the parent Plugin constructor

A plugin should be a self-contained module that provides additional functionality for a Client. A plugin could do something as simple as logging all command output to a logging channel, registering a set of custom commands for the client to use, or even providing new localization language packs.

A plugin should not attempt to register custom commands via any means other than [<Client>.commands.registerExternal()]{@link CommandRegistry#registerExternal}, otherwise any custom commands could be unloaded if the reload command is called

Note: A plugin is expected to have two things at runtime: a name property containing the name of the plugin, and an async init() method that will be called by the framework after loading the plugin.
See: {@link IPlugin#name} and {@link IPlugin#init}
Warning: Given the nature of the Plugin system, this allows you to use code from other people for your bot. Considering any plugin will have access to your Client instance and thus your Bot token, you should be absolutely certain that the plugin is not going to do anything malicious before using it

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: The YAMDBF Client instance. This will be passed by the plugin loader when the plugin is loaded at runtime. This will automatically be received and stored under <Plugin>.client unless you provide your own constructor implementation, in which case it must be received and passed to super()

functions.name: init
functions.description: Async method that will be called by the Plugin loader when the Plugin is loaded. This is the only method that will be called by the framework automatically, so this should be where anything necessary should be done to make the Plugin operational

classes.name: PluginLoader
classes.description: Loads plugins and holds loaded plugins in case accessing loaded plugins at runtime is desired

properties.name: loaded
properties.description: Object mapping Plugin names to Plugin instances

functions.name: _loadPlugins
functions.description: Loads the plugins passed in the YAMDBF Client options. Called internally by the YAMDBF Client at startup

classes.name: Command
classes.description: Command class to extend to create commands users can execute

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the command, used by the dispatcher to determine the command being executed

properties.name: desc
properties.description: A brief description of the command, displayed in the commands list via the Help command

properties.name: usage
properties.description: An example of command usage. The token <prefix> will be replaced by the guild-specific command prefix in the Help command when help <command> is called

properties.name: info
properties.description: Extra information about the command to be displayed by the Help command when help <command> is called

properties.name: group
properties.description: The command group that the command belongs to. Allows commands to be grouped for disabling. The group 'base' cannot be disabled.

properties.name: aliases
properties.description: Aliases the command can be called by other than its name

properties.name: guildOnly
properties.description: Whether or not a command can only be used within a guild text channel

properties.name: hidden
properties.description: Whether or not the command is to be hidden from the commands list via the default help command

properties.name: argOpts
properties.description:
Options for how arguments should be parsed.
See: {@link ArgOpts}

properties.name: callerPermissions
properties.description:
Array of permissions required by the command caller to be able to execute the command in the guild the command is called in.

If any permissions are provided the command's guildOnly property will be automatically overridden to true

properties.name: clientPermissions
properties.description:
Array of permissions required by the client to be able to execute the command in the guild the command is called in.

If any permissions are provided the command's guildOnly property will be automatically overridden to true

properties.name: roles
properties.description:
Array of specific {@link external:Role} names required to use the command. If the command caller has any (even just one) of the roles in the array, they will be able to use the command.

If any roles are provided the command's guildOnly property will be automatically set to true

Note: This is far inferior to {@link Command#callerPermissions}, using the base limit command's role-limiting system, or really even a custom-engineered solution to control who can use a command. Forcing servers to create Roles with specific names makes your bot that much less configurable on a per-guild basis, and configurability is what YAMDBF is all about. But, for the sake of simplicity, this is available

properties.name: ownerOnly
properties.description:
Whether or not the command can be used only by the client/bot owner(s).
See: [Client#config.owner]{@link Client#config}

properties.name: overloads
properties.description: The name of a base command to overload. Commands may only overload base commands so the {@link Command#group} must be set to 'base' in order to overload. You must also be sure to not disable the base command that you are overloading. Commands may only be overloaded by name, not by alias

properties.name: external
properties.description: Whether or not this command was registered via {@link CommandRegistry#registerExternal} by some means other than the command loader like a Plugin

functions.name: action
functions.description: Action to be executed when the command is called. The following parameters are what command actions will be passed by the {@link CommandDispatcher} whenever a command is called. Be sure to receive these in proper order when writing new commands

parameters.name: args
parameters.description:
An array containing the args parsed from the command calling message.
Will contain strings unless middleware is used to transform the args

functions.name: _register
functions.description: Make necessary asserts for Command validity. Called internally by the command loader

functions.name: use
functions.description:
Adds a middleware function to be used when the command is called to make modifications to args, determine if the command can be run, or anything else you want to do whenever this command is called.

See {@link MiddlewareFunction} for information on how a middleware function should be represented

Usage example:

<Client>.use((message, args) => [message, args.map(a => a.toUpperCase())]);

This will add a middleware function to this command that will attempt to transform all args to uppercase. This will of course fail if any of the args are not a string.

Note: Middleware functions should only be added to a command one time each and thus should not be added within any sort of event or loop. Multiple separate middleware functions can be added to the via multiple separate calls to this method

functions.name: respond
functions.description: Send provided response to the provided message's channel via edit or send, depending on whether or not the client is a selfbot

functions.name: _validatePermissions
functions.description: Validate PermissionResolvables in the given array, throwing an error for any that are invalid

functions.name: setReady
functions.description: Set the dispatcher as ready to receive and dispatch commands

functions.name: handleMessage
functions.description: Handle received messages

functions.name: isCommandCalled
functions.description: Return if a command has been called, the called command the prefix used to call the command, and the name or alias of the command used to call it

functions.name: testCommand
functions.description: Test if the command caller is allowed to use the command under whatever circumstances are present at call-time

functions.name: checkRateLimiter
functions.description: Check either global or command-specific rate limits for the given message author and also notify them if they exceed ratelimits

functions.name: checkRateLimits
functions.description: Check global and command-specific ratelimits for the user for the given command

functions.name: checkClientPermissions
functions.description: Check that the client has the permissions requested by the command in the channel the command is being called in

functions.name: checkCallerPermissions
functions.description: Compare user permissions to the command's requisites

functions.name: checkLimiter
functions.description: Compare user roles to the command's limiter

functions.name: hasRoles
functions.description: Compare user roles to the command's requisites

functions.name: isBlacklisted
functions.description: Check if the calling user is blacklisted

functions.name: dispatch
functions.description: Execute the provided command with the provided args

functions.name: unknownCommandError
functions.description: Return an error for unknown commands in DMs

functions.name: guildOnlyError
functions.description: Return an error for guild only commands

functions.name: missingClientPermissionsError
functions.description: Return an error for missing caller permissions

functions.name: missingCallerPermissionsError
functions.description: Return an error for missing caller permissions

functions.name: failedLimiterError
functions.description: Return an error for failing a command limiter

functions.name: missingRolesError
functions.description: Return an error for missing roles

classes.name: CommandLoader
classes.description: Handles loading all commands from the given Client's commandsDir

functions.name: loadCommands
functions.description: Load or reload all commands from the base commands directory and the user-specified {@link Client#commandsDir} directory and stores them in the Client's {@link CommandRegistry} instance ({@link Client#commands})

functions.name: reloadCommand
functions.description: Reload the given command in the Client's {@link CommandRegistry} ({@link Client#commands})

functions.name: getCommandClass
functions.description: Get the Command class from an attempted Command class import

classes.name: CommandRegistry
classes.description: Stores loaded Commands in a Collection keyed by each Command's name property

functions.name: _registerInternal
functions.description: Complete registration of a command and add to the parent collection, erroring on duplicate names and aliases. This is an internal method and should not be used. Use registerExternal() instead

functions.name: registerExternal
functions.description:
Register an external command and add it to the <Client>.commands [collection]{@link external:Collection}, erroring on duplicate names and aliases. External commands will be preserved when the reload command is called.

Note: This is intended for Plugins to use to register external commands with the Client instance. Under normal circumstances commands should be added by placing them in the directory passed to the commandsDir YAMDBF Client option

functions.name: findByNameOrAlias
functions.description: Finds a command by [name]{@link Command#name} or [alias]{@link Command#aliases}

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The name or alias of the Command

functions.name: filterGuildUsable
functions.description: Returns a Promise resolving with a collection of all commands usable by the caller in the guild text channel the provided message is in. Needs to be async due to having to access guild settings to check for disabled groups

functions.name: filterDMUsable
functions.description: Returns all commands usable by the caller within the DM channel the provided message is in

functions.name: filterDMHelp
functions.description: Returns all commands that can have their help looked up by the caller in the DM channel the message is in

classes.name: RateLimit
classes.description: Maintains its own call count and expiry for making sure things only happen a certain number of times within a given timeframe

functions.name: _reset
functions.description: Sets this RateLimit to default values

functions.name: call
functions.description: Returns whether or not this rate limit has been capped out for its current expiry window while incrementing calls towards the rate limit cap if not currently capped

functions.name: setNotified
functions.description: Flag this RateLimit as having had the user the RateLimit is for notified of being rate limited

properties.name: isLimited
properties.description: Return whether or not this ratelimit is currently capped out

properties.name: wasNotified
properties.description: Return whether or not this RateLimit was flagged after notifying the user of being rate limited

classes.name: RateLimiter
classes.description: Handles assigning ratelimits to guildmembers and users

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Ratelimit string matching the regex \d+\/\d+[s|m|h|d]
Example: 1/10m to limit a command to one use per 10 minutes

parameters.name: global
parameters.description: Whether or not this RateLimiter handles global ratelimits

functions.name: get
functions.description: Returns the RateLimit object for the message author if global or message member if message is in a guild. If a userOverride is given then the RateLimit or global RateLimit will be retrieved for that user based on the message location

parameters.name: userOverride
parameters.description: User object to use in place of Message author

functions.name: _parseLimit
functions.description: Parse the ratelimit from the given input string

functions.name: _isGlobal
functions.description: Determine whether or not to use the global rate limit collection

functions.name: parseFile
functions.description: Parse a given language file string and return a Language object containing all the parsed values

classes.name: Language
classes.description: Holds the localization strings for a given language

functions.name: concat
functions.description: Concatenate another Language object's strings of the same language with this Language object's strings, saving them to this Language object's strings value

classes.name: Database
classes.description:
Note: This won't do anything for you if you're not using a StorageProvider for your client that uses Sequelize

Holds the Sequelize connection to whichever database backend is chosen via the Client StorageProvider. As long as you wait until clientReady you can safely use {@link Database.instance} to get the Database instance and access the Sequelize connection via {@link Database#db}

This will allow you to define and access your own Sequelize Models without having to create another database connection. This is especially important when using SQLiteProvider as SQLite does not like having multiple connections

properties.name: db
properties.description: The Sequelize connection to the database specified by your chosen storage provider

functions.name: instance
functions.description: As long as a Sequelize-using storage provider is being used, this will return the Database instance holding the Sequelize connection to the database

functions.name: init
functions.description: Authenticate the connection to the database

classes.name: GuildSettings
classes.description: Class containing asynchronous methods for storing, retrieving, and interacting with settings for a specific guild. Will be contained under {@link GuildStorage#settings}

functions.name: init
functions.description: Initialize this storage instance

functions.name: keys
functions.description: Get the names of all keys in this storage for this Guild

functions.name: get
functions.description: Get a value from storage for this Guild

functions.name: exists
functions.description: Check if a value exists in storage for this Guild

functions.name: set
functions.description: Set a value in storage for this Guild

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Remove a value from storage for this Guild

functions.name: clear
functions.description: Remove all key/value pairs from storage for this Guild

classes.name: GuildStorageLoader
classes.description: Handles loading all guild-specific data from persistent storage into {@link GuildStorage} objects

functions.name: loadStorages
functions.description: Load data for each guild from persistent storage and store it in a {@link GuildStorage} object

functions.name: initNewGuilds
functions.description: Create GuildStorage for all guilds that do not currently have one for the Client session

functions.name: cleanGuilds
functions.description: Clean out any storages/settings storages for guilds the bot is no longer a part of

classes.name: KeyedStorage
classes.description: Simple key/value storage abstraction operating on top of the given StorageProvider. Supports nested object paths in get/set/remove using . like normal object accessors

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Unique identifier for this storage, used by the given StorageProvider

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: The storage provider class that will be instantiated and used as the backend for this storage abstraction

functions.name: init
functions.description: Initialize this storage. Any other method calls should not be made until this method has been called and resolved

functions.name: keys
functions.description: Get the names of all keys in this storage

functions.name: get
functions.description: Get a value from this storage for the specified key

functions.name: exists
functions.description: Check if a value exists in storage

functions.name: set
functions.description: Set a value in this storage for the specified key

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Remove a key/value pair from this storage

functions.name: clear
functions.description: Remove all key/value pairs from this storage

constructor.name: StorageFactory
constructor.description: Used for creating the different storage class mixins used throughout and needed by YAMDBF Clients. Used internally, shouldn't ever need to be used directly in a custom client

parameters.name: guildDataStorage
parameters.description: StorageProvider instance that provides all guild data

parameters.name: guildSettingStorage
parameters.description: StorageProvider instance that provides all guild settings

functions.name: createGuildStorage
functions.description: Creates a GuildStorage mixin, creating the GuildSettings instance under .settings

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Guild to create storage for

functions.name: createClientStorage
functions.description: Creates a ClientStorage mixin using KeyedStorage as a base. Adds a guilds Collection that will map Guild IDs to GuildStorages

classes.name: StorageProvider
classes.description:
Abstract class for storage providers to extend. Provides runtime errors for missing method implementations, and is necessary at compile-time when using TypeScript for the compiler to recognize a StorageProvider as valid.

StorageProviders must present an interface with a storage solution that provides access to string values via string keys. Data will be stored in the storage solution by the framework as stringified JSON-valid data

Note: All methods shown on this class must be implemented within any storage providers you create and, in the case of keys() and get(), must return the proper data types or your client will not work.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
Name of the storage to access. Can be a DB table, file name, etc. Whatever the storage solution expects with regards to providing a unique identifier for a specific storage.

Note: This does not need to be passed to super() in classes extending StorageProvider as StorageProvider is abstract and provides no implementation, but should be received by and used within your storage provider constructors as necessary to create a unique storage based on the given string

functions.name: init
functions.description: Async method to be run that will set up the storage provider for use. Calls to other provider methods should not be made until this method has been called and resolved

functions.name: keys
functions.description: Async method returning an array of stored key names

functions.name: get
functions.description: Async method that gets the value of a key in storage

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The name of the key in storage

functions.name: set
functions.description: Async method that sets the value of a key in storage

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The name of the key in storage

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Async method that removes a key and its value from storage

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The name of the key in storage

functions.name: clear
functions.description: Async method that removes all keys and their values from storage

classes.name: ClientStorage
classes.description: Class containing asynchronous methods for storing, retrieving, and interacting with data specific to the Client instance. Can not be created directly via a constructor due to mixin mechanics. Created internally via StorageFactory#createClientStorage

functions.name: init
functions.description: Initialize this storage. Any other method calls should not be made until this method has been called and resolved

functions.name: keys
functions.description: Get the names of all keys in this storage

functions.name: get
functions.description: Get a value from this storage for the specified key

functions.name: set
functions.description: Set a value in this storage for the specified key

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Remove a key/value pair from this storage

functions.name: clear
functions.description: Remove all key/value pairs from this storage

classes.name: GuildStorage
classes.description: Class containing asynchronous methods for storing, retrieving, and interacting with data for a specific guild. Can not be created directly via a constructor due to mixin mechanics. Created internally via StorageFactory#createGuildStorage

properties.name: settings
properties.description: GuildSettings object containing settings for this guild

functions.name: init
functions.description: Initialize this storage instance

functions.name: keys
functions.description: Get the names of all keys in this storage for this Guild

functions.name: get
functions.description: Get a value from storage for this Guild

functions.name: set
functions.description: Set a value in storage for this Guild

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Remove a value from storage for this Guild

functions.name: clear
functions.description: Remove all key/value pairs from storage for this Guild

classes.name: Logger
classes.description:
Singleton containing methods for asynchronous logging with clean, configurable output

Easiest manner of use is via the @logger parameter decorator to attach the logger to a class property for use within that class. Otherwise the singleton instance can be accessed via Logger.instance()

Logging can be turned off by setting the logging level to LogLevel.NONE

functions.name: instance
functions.description: Returns the Logger singleton instance

functions.name: setLogLevel
functions.description: Set the level of output that will be logged

functions.name: addTransport
functions.description: Add a {@link Transport} for the Logger to use for logging. The logger will log to all provided transports

functions.name: removeBaseTransport
functions.description:
Remove the default console logging transport. This is useful if you want to provide your own transport that uses the console.

This should be run before creating a YAMDBF Client instance if you do not any logging to be done with the base transport before you get the chance to swap it out.

Logger.instance().removeBaseTransport();
Logger.instance().addTransport({ transport[, level] });

functions.name: log
functions.description: Log useful information to the Logger transports. Will not be logged unless the log level is LogLevel.LOG or higher

functions.name: info
functions.description: Log less important information to the logger transports. Will not be logged unless the logging level is LogLevel.INFO or higher

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Tag to prefix the log with to identify the source of the log

functions.name: warn
functions.description: Log warning text to the logger transports. Will not be logged unless the logging level is LogLevel.WARN or higher

functions.name: error
functions.description: Log error text to the logger transports. Will not be logged unless the logging level is LogLevel.ERROR or higher

functions.name: debug
functions.description: Log debug text to the logger transports. Will not be logged unless the logging level is LogLevel.DEBUG

functions.name: _write
functions.description: Send log data to all transports

typedefs.name: Tuple
typedefs.description:
Represents an array of fixed length where the the item in the specified position is of the specified type.

Example:

['foo', 10] === [string, number] === Tuple<string, number>

typedefs.name: ArgOpts
typedefs.description: Object containing options for controlling how command arguments will be parsed

typedefs.name: CommandInfo
typedefs.description: Object containing required {@link Command} properties to be passed to a Command on construction

properties.name: ratelimit
properties.description: Sets a rate limit on calls to this command for every user

typedefs.name: DefaultGuildSettings
typedefs.description: The default settings to apply to new guilds. Stored under the key 'defaultGuildSettings' in {@link Client#storage}

typedefs.name: Difference
typedefs.description: Represents a difference between two given valid Unix time signatures

properties.name: hours
properties.description: Number of hours spanned after higher units are subtracted

properties.name: minutes
properties.description: Number of minutes spanned after higher units are subtracted

properties.name: secs
properties.description: Number of seconds spanned after higher units are subtracted

properties.name: toString()
properties.description: Returns duration formatted as # days, # hours, # mins, # secs

typedefs.name: ExpectArgType
typedefs.description:
Valid arg type values for [expect]{@link module:Middleware.expect}. Can be one of the following string literals:

'String' | 'Number' | 'User' | 'Member' | 'Role' | 'Channel' | 'Any'

or an Array of possible string literal values if specific string options are desired

typedefs.name: LocalizedCommandInfo
typedefs.description: Represents an object containing localization overrides for a command's desc, info, and usage fields

typedefs.name: LogData
typedefs.description: Represents an object passed from {@link Logger} to any {@link TransportFunction}s given to it

properties.name: type
properties.description: The log type. Will be one of: LOG | INFO | WARN | ERROR | DEBUG

typedefs.name: LogLevel
typedefs.description:
Enum containing the different levels of potential logger output. Each level represents itself and everything above it in the enum. The default logger log level is LogLevel.LOG

enum LogLevel
{
    NONE,
    LOG,
    INFO,
    WARN,
    ERROR.
    DEBUG
}

typedefs.name: MiddlewareFunction
typedefs.description:
A function that takes a Message object and an array of args, does anything with them, and returns a {@link Tuple} where the first item is the Message object and the second item is the array of args

(Message, any[]) => [Message, any[]]

Can be async as long as the returned promise resolves with the tuple containing the message object and the args array as expected.

If a middleware function returns a string, or throws a string/error, it will be sent to the calling channel as a message and the Command execution will be aborted. If a middleware function does not return anything or returns something other than an array or string, the Command will fail silently.

Note: The command dispatcher will attempt to bind the Command instance to the middleware function when called, so this within a middleware function (if it is not an arrow function) will be the Command instance at runtime

typedefs.name: PluginConstructor
typedefs.description: Any class that extends and implements {@link Plugin}. Not to be confused with an instance of a Plugin.

typedefs.name: ResolveArgType
typedefs.description:
Valid arg type values for [resolve]{@link module:Middleware.resolve}. Can be one of the following string literals:

'String' | 'Number' | 'Duration' | 'User' | 'Member' | 'BannedUser' | 'Channel' | 'Role'

typedefs.name: ResourceLoader
typedefs.description: Represents a function assigned to a specific language that takes a string key and an optional {@link TemplateData} object and returns a localized string for that language if it exists

typedefs.name: StorageProviderConstructor
typedefs.description: Any class that extends and implements {@link StorageProvider} and provides an interface with a storage medium allowing data to be stored, retrieved, and manipulated. Not to be confused with an instance of a storage provider.

typedefs.name: TemplateData
typedefs.description: Represents an object mapping template keys to string values, where the template keys will be replaced with the provided values in the source string when given to a Lang resource function like [Lang.res()]{@link module:Lang.res}

typedefs.name: Transport
typedefs.description: Represents a transport object for the {@link Logger}.

properties.name: transport
properties.description: The transport function to use for this transport

properties.name: level
properties.description: The log level for this transport. Will default dynamically to the Logger's log level if none is provided

typedefs.name: TransportFunction
typedefs.description: Represents a function to be given to {@link Logger#addTransport} that will receive log data. What is done with that log data is up to you, but logging to a file or a database would be some examples

typedefs.name: YAMDBFOptions
typedefs.description: Object containing required {@link Client} properties to be passed to a Client on construction

properties.name: token
properties.description: Token needed to connect the Client to Discord

properties.name: owner
properties.description:
Can also be a single string
See: {@link Client#owner}

properties.name: ratelimit
properties.description: Sets a global rate limit on command calls for every user

properties.name: logLevel
properties.description: Sets the logging level for the logger. Defaults to LogLevel.LOG

properties.name: plugins
properties.description: An array of Plugin classes (not instances) or plugin package name strings to be loaded and used

mixins.name: Guild
mixins.description: Represents a Discord.js Guild object that has had a {@link GuildStorage} object for the guild the message was sent from, if any, mixed in by the CommandDispatcher before being passed to the command action upon Command execution

mixins.name: Message
mixins.description:
Represents a Discord.js Message object that contains a modifed {@link Guild} object containing a {@link GuildStorage} for the associated guild, if the message was sent from within a guild, mixed in by the CommandDispatcher.

Note: For clients written in Typescript, you will want to import Message from YAMDBF rather than Discord.js to be able to access message.guild.storage within your commands without compiler errors

functions.name: deprecated
functions.description: Logs a deprecation warning for the decorated class method whenever it is called

functions.name: logger
functions.description:
Property decorator that will automatically assign the Logger singleton instance to the decorated class property

Example:

class Foo {
    @logger private readonly logger: Logger;
    ...

Note: This is a Typescript feature. If using the logger is desired in Javascript you should simply retrieve the singleton instance via Logger.instance()
